p: Liu et al. (2022) found that both the surface and canopy UHI were reduced during the COVID‐19 lockdown. This was initially counterintuitive to me because our study (Jin et al., 2010) found that aerosols can reduce urban surface temperature. That finding would suggest that reduced human‐caused aerosols in the atmosphere because of the lockdown might lead to an enhanced UHI. Liu et al. (2022) has renewed my thinking about the particular role of aerosols in surface temperature, and that topic should be examined perhaps using the COVID‐19 lockdown perspective. It would be particularly interesting to understand the relative changes and distribution of scattering aerosols in the urban – rural environment during the lockdown periods.
